text: Giovanni "Tinto" Brass (born 26 March 1933) is an Italian movie director, producer and screenwriter. He was born in Milan, Italy. In the 1960s and 1970s, he directed many avant-garde movies. He is known for his movies Caligula, Cos√¨ fan tutte (released under the English title All Ladies Do It), Paprika, Monella (Frivolous Lola) and Trasgredire. In April 2010, Brass was hospitalized after having an intracranial hemorrhage. ==References== ==Other websites== * . * Category:1933 births Category:Living people Category:Italian movie directors Category:Italian movie producers Category:Italian screenwriters Category:Writers from Milan
title: Tinto Brass
